steps.title: Mix the yeast in a large bowl with the brown sugar and the warm water.
steps.content: Mix the yeast in a large bowl with the brown sugar and the warm water. Stir in the salt and flour, ensuring all the flour is well hydrated. Knead the dough 5-7 minutes, until it is smooth. Cover the bowl and set aside for 2 hours.

steps.title: Lightly dust a cutting board with flour.
steps.content: Lightly dust a cutting board with flour. Turn out the dough onto a floured board. With a dough knife, cut a 4oz portion and mold into a ball. Allow the dough balls to rest 5 minutes. Pierce the ball with your finger and rotate the dough around until the hole is of desired size. Set the bagel on a cornmeal-flour dusted sheet tray and repeat. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 450 F or 232 C.
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 450 F or 232 C. Dust another baking sheet with a mixture of cornmeal and flour.

steps.title: Fill a large, wide pot two-thirds full of water, and bring to a boil with the baking soda.
steps.content: Fill a large, wide pot two-thirds full of water, and bring to a boil with the baking soda. Drop the bagels in batches into the water; they must not touch. Boil on one side for 2 minutes. Turn the bagels and boil on the second side for 1Â½ minutes. They should firm and puff up. Carefully remove from the water and drain for 1 minute on a rack.

steps.title: Place the bagels on the prepared baking sheet.
steps.content: Place the bagels on the prepared baking sheet. Immediately place the sheet in the oven and bake for 15 minutes. Rotate the sheet tray 90 and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the bagels are tan to medium brown. The finished bagel should reach 185 on an instant read thermometer. Remove from the baking sheets and cool for 30 minutes before attempting to cut.
